quote: Captain, we are approaching   Klavdia Three.
Take us to impulse power.
Aye, sir. Impulse power.
Bridge, this is Engineering.
Yes, Lieutenant.
Now that we are out of warp, I   would like to use this time to   make routine adjustments to the   deuterium control conduit. It's   overdue.
That would preclude use of our   warp drive engines.
How much time do these adjustments   require?
A few hours, sir.
You may proceed, Lieutenant La   Forge. Standard orbit.
Aye, sir. Standard orbit.
I am going to need an S-C-M, model   three, from stores.
Right away.
Magnify.
Not a very inviting planet. Even   for a research outpost.
I would have thought the   inhabitants of Daled Four would   send a future leader to a more   hospitable environment.
For some, security is more   important than comfort.
But sixteen years...
We are being hailed, Captain.
Open hailing frequencies, Mister   Worf.
Hailing frequencies open.
This is Captain Picard of the USS   Enterprise.
The planet's troposphere is   distorting the signal.
Can you clean it up?
I'll try.
This is Picard -- would you please   repeat your message?
I am Anya. Have you come for   Salia of Daled Four?
That is correct.
What species are you?
Human.
Excellent. Bring us aboard. That   is all.
Friendly, isn't she?
Whether they're friendly or not,   Salia has the rank of head of   state. We will treat both her   and Anya accordingly. Number   One, Mister Worf, let's greet our   visitors.
Welcome aboard the Enterprise.   I am Captain Jean-Luc Picard.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: This is Salia of Daled Four.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: I didn't feel a thing. Is that   normal when you are transported,   Captain?
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: It is.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: Those must be the matter/energy   conversion controls. May I take   a look?
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: Of course.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: If you like, I'll arrange a tour   of the ship.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: I'd love that.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: No.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: That won't be necessary. Just   show us our quarters, Captain   Picard.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: Very well.
scene: 5    INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER PAD

quote: We are housing you in the quarters   normally reserved for Starfleet   admiralty. I'm sure you'll find   them quite comfortable.
That's a superconducting magnet,   isn't it?
Yes... It's a... say, how did you   know that?
Study, for the last sixteen years   it is all I could...
Please walk ahead with me.
You'd better be careful. I was   taught those can rip the iron   right out of your blood cells.
Who are you? No one mentioned   we were beaming up such a... a...
Please, Salia.
I don't believe this! Who is she?
I think she's a governess.
Not her. The girl.
I doubt she'll have time for you,   my friend. She's slated to rule   an entire world.
Come in.
You wanted to see me.
Data -- the girl who just came on   board.
Salia of Daled Four.
There's almost nothing in the   computer about her.
Very little is known.
What can you tell me?

She was born on Daled Four. Her   parents were from opposite sides   of factions which have been   feuding for centuries. They died   shortly after her birth. A   Federation ship brought her and   her governess to Klavdia Three   to be raised in a neutral   environment.
And now she's returning.
It is hoped she will unite the   factions and bring peace.
Wesley, are you all right?
Geordi.    (then remembering the     magnet)   Oh... Yes.. I'm fine... I just...
We are waiting for the part.
I'm on my way.
Got to go. Thanks, Data.
Captain, we've laid in a course   for Daled Four. We will remain   on impulse power until Lieutenant   La Forge completes his   adjustments.
Status report on our passengers,   Lieutenant Worf. Did the   accommodations meet with their   approval?
I doubt anything ever meets with   that woman's approval, sir.
Captain, I'm concerned.
About... ?
Our new passengers. Their   emotions do not seem to fit...       ... well, who they are and what   they're doing.
Are you suggesting they're not   who they say they are?
Actually... no. It's more like   they're not exactly what they seem   to be. At least, not exactly.
Captain Picard to Salia's   quarters. May I turn on the   viewer?
Yes, of course.
Are your quarters satisfactory?
Yes. Very.
Thank you for checking on us,   Captain. I only hope my quarters   on Daled Four will be this   luxurious.
Feel free to contact me if you   need anything. Picard out.
What I sensed in that seems   entirely normal. Emotionally,   I judge her to be very drawn to   our young ensign.

What puzzles me, Captain, is how   she is expected to bring peace   to Daled Four. The one thing   we do know about it is that its   inhabitants have been fighting   throughout their recorded history.
What do we know about the cause   of their wars?
Only that it is the difference   between night and day.
Data, you just used a   colloquialism.

I did? I meant that Daled Four   does not rotate. One side has   constant night, the other constant   daylight. One might surmise that   the two hemispheres developed   disparate cultures, which is a   major cause of most wars.
And yet somehow this child is   supposed to bring them together.
She looks too delicate for a task   like that.
Do not be fooled by her looks.   The body is just a shell.
How can I be a leader if I don't   know anything about my people?
You will lead because you are   accepted by both sides. And   because it is in your blood.
What am I expected to do when I   get there?
You will know.
How?
You just will. Salia, you must   arrive with an open mind, without   preconceived ideas about the world   you will find or the people on   either side.
It's very frustrating.
Yes -- I know. You feel the weight   of so much responsibility. And   you're not sure you can live up   to everyone's expectations.
It's not only that. Nobody's   asked me if this is something I   want.
It is your duty.
I have no choice.
None. It won't be as bad as you   think. In fact it could be quite   wonderful. Besides... you are   the last and only chance.
Don't you think I'm going to need   more than instinct to do whatever   is expected of me on Daled Four?
Energy depletion level.
Point oh-four percent and   increasing.
Wesley?
Wesley! Haven't you found the   defocused area yet?
I'm looking!
I see the way you're looking.
Sorry.
I've got my mind on something.
Geordi, this girl they beamed up,   she's... she's perfect! Perfect!
Now I understand why you can't   concentrate.
I'll do better.
Warning -- resonant field applied!   Warning!
What is it?
I had it on the wrong setting.
I suppose it had to happen to you.   It usually does at about this age.
What usually does?
Glands suddenly meshing together.   It happens to all of us.
You've got to be joking. Just   because I said she's   interesting...
You said she's "perfect."       Go. You're no use here for now.   Go talk to her. Take the lift.
That's silly, Geordi.       Well, since you recommend it...   If she'll talk to me, how should   I approach her? What would I say?
Just say "Hi. I'm Wesley Crusher.   I'd like to talk to you."
And then what?
Whatever occurs to you.
What if nothing occurs to me?
Wesley, I don't really have time   for this. You're going to have   to ask somebody else.
Okay.
That is how the Klingon lures a   mate.
Are you telling me to go yell at   Salia?
No. Men do not roar. Women roar.   Then they hurl heavy objects.   And claw at you.
What does the man do?
He reads love poetry. He ducks   a lot.
Yes, well, that might work for   Klingons, but I think I should   try something less dangerous.
Then go to her door. Beg like   a human.

It should be that simple, Wesley.   Judging by her appearance it is   likely you and Salia are   biologically compatible. Of   course, there may be a difference   in the histocompatibility complex   in the cell membrane.
Data! I want to meet her, not   dissect her.
Captain Picard to Salia's   quarters.
Yes, Captain?
May I activate the viewer?
Certainly.
I've arranged for Anya to have   a tour of the ship. Maybe you'd   like to go along.
Very much.
Your escort will be there shortly.   Picard out.
I think I'll go on the tour.
Why can't I?
This is ridiculous! This will   be the only chance I ever have   to see a vessel like this.
No -- you must remain here where   it is safe.
Salia, do an old woman a favor,   and obey me for the rest of this   trip.
You're no more an old woman than   I am a leader.
Yes. Come in.
I am here to escort you on a tour   of the Enterprise.
I will be right there.       You are a leader. And I am older   than you could ever imagine.
But what do I say? How should   I act? What do I do?
Guinan, I need your help. Could   you sit over there?
That seems simple enough.
The first words out of your mouth   are the most important. You could   start by saying something like...       ... "you're the most beautiful   woman in the galaxy."
But that might not work.
Yes it would.
If you only knew how much I wanted   to tell you that.
But you were afraid.
Yes.
Of me?
Of us. Of what we could become...
Commander Riker...
... and that you might have   thought it was a line.
Maybe I do think it's a line.
Then you think I'm not sincere?
I didn't say that. There's   nothing wrong with a line. It's   like a knock on the door.
Then you're inviting me in?
I'm not sending you away.
That's more than I expected.
But is it more than you hoped?
To hope is to recognize the   possibility. I had only dreams.
Dreams can be dangerous.
Not these dreams.
I dream of a galaxy where your   eyes are stars... And all the   universe worships night.
Careful, if you place me too high   on a pedestal, you won't be able   to reach me.
Then I'll learn to fly. You are   the heart in my day and the soul   of my night.
I don't think this is my style.
Shut up, kid.       Now tell me more about my eyes.
What is that? What are you doing?
This is the Deuterium Control   Conduit. I'm probing it to find   a defocused area.
Is there a problem with the ship?
There's nothing to be concerned   about. I'm just making routine   adjustments.
I understand.
Ensign Crusher, what are you doing   here?
Nothing.
Is there a problem?
Can you show me how to work the   food dispenser?
Sure.
No, I meant him.
Actually all you have to do is   tell the computer what you want   and it will prepare it for you.
Oh... what should I order?
I don't know. what do you like?
I'd like something sweet.
I know... Computer, Thalian   chocolate mousse.
It's a wonderful sensation.
On Thalos Seven they age the cocoa   beans four hundred years.
You've been there?
It's one of my favorite places.
It must have been fun to visit   a planet like that!
It's the best part of being on   the Enterprise.
I have learned about some of them,   but to see them -- that would be   wonderful.       Tell me about some of the other   places you've been.
There's too many!
The only world I've known is   Klavdia Three.
It's time we changed that.
How?
Come with me.
I'll be with you in a moment.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: What's wrong with him?
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: Andronesian Encephalitis. He   contracted it when our transporter   filter was disrupted by a cosmic   ray burst.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: That disease is contagious.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: Yes it is.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: Then we could all be infected.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: Very unlikely. The air filtering   system can handle --
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: But there is a chance.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: If you mean mathematically... Yes,   the probability is not zero.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: I cannot rely on your primitive   technologies. Kill the patient!
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: What?
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: Destroy the patient immediately!
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: Calm down -- really there's no   risk.
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: If you won't take action, then   I will!
scene: 33   INT. SICKBAY - PATIENTS' QUARTERS - ON ANYA

quote: Security to Sickbay! Hurry!
Hold your fire.
Anya!
What is she? Keep her away!
Do not interfere!
She wants to kill Hennesey!
His disease threatens Salia!
Captain, there is no chance of   contagion.
The situation is under control.
That's not good enough!
It will have to be.
Your powers are infinitesimal   compared to mine!
Nevertheless, you will obey my   orders. You are to remain in your   quarters and in your present form   for the remainder of this voyage.   Is that clear?
Very.
Keep her under guard.
What kind of creature is she?
I've never seen anything like her.

There are no such life-forms in   the galactic zoological catalog.   There have been rumors of a   species called allasomorphs which   are supposed to possess the power   to alter their molecular structure   into that of other life-forms.
Such a species would make a   perfect "protector."
I want a security team stationed   outside Sickbay, Mister Worf.
Aye, sir. Captain... if Anya   transforms?
Stop her.
Remain here.       You are restricted to these   quarters for the remainder of this   voyage.
Can a place so remarkable truly   exist?
Oh, yes. And there are so many   more -- all special - -all so   different. And all the different   kinds of life-forms.
I have learned about them. That   is all I did on Klavdia Three...   was learn. I know so much, but   I've seen so little.
Then, think of what you have to   look forward to. This is the best   time to be alive.
For you.
For us both. Everything is just   beginning. We've only charted   nineteen percent of our galaxy...   the rest is out there -- waiting   for us. And already, look at   what we've discovered.
I have never seen anything so   wondrous.
Wait. Computer -- Rosseau Five.
I can't believe a place like this   really exists.
Oh, yes.
And you have been there?
And one day you'll visit Rosseau   Five... and other places and more   spectacular than this.
If only that were possible.
Now, listen. In a moment the   orbits of the moons will become   synchronous.
It is so beautiful -- like this   place has a voice and is trying   to talk with us.
I never thought of it that way.
Thank you for sharing all of this   with me.
Soon you'll see it for yourself.
I don't think so.       Maybe we should go.
How about something to drink?
How about some more of that   Thalian chocolate?
We have obviously brought a very   dangerous life-form aboard this   ship. I want to minimize the   chances of another incident.
Captain, whatever kind of   life-form Anya may be,   emotionally she is really Salia's   mother.
And the most dangerous animal is   a mother protecting her young.
Exactly.
Captain, this is Anya.
Yes?
Salia is gone. Where is she?
This has all been so wonderful.   I'm not sure it's real.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Believe me, the Ten-Forward room   is not an illusion.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Not that. I mean the way I feel.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Tell her about her eyes.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: You won't find a better dish of   chocolate on Thalos or Daled Four.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: I'm sure I won't...
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Is something wrong?
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: I've had a great time being with   you, Wesley.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: That makes you sad?
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: When I was on Klavdia Three all   I could think of was leaving that   isolation.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Is that what awaits you on Daled   Four?
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Yes.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: But I thought you were going there   to unite two groups which have   been fighting.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: (a little surprised that     he knew that)   What else do you know?
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Very little. There is almost   nothing in the ship's computer   about Daled Four. What will you   do there?
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Your language has no word for the   position I will hold. I only know   I will have a lot of duties when   I get there. In many ways I'll   have even less freedom than I did   on Klavdia Three.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: You could stay.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: On the Enterprise?
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Why not?
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Because...
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: Just because a girl runs out,   doesn't mean she's not hoping   you'll follow.
scene: 46   INT. TEN-FORWARD - ON WESLEY AND SALIA

quote: What is it? What happened?
Salia!
Stay away from me!
I'm sorry.
I don't understand.
Wesley, I can't stay here! I   can't have this life! I want it   more than anything, but I can't   have it!
Salia, nothing is impossible!
Not for you.
There's a way. I know there is!
Leave her alone!
(stern, a hint of     tension)   Wesley, step away from her.
Come with me.
Energy depletion level.
Zero.
La Forge to bridge.
Yes, Lieutenant?
I have just completed the final   adjustments. Thank you for giving   me the time. You now have warp   engines available.
Very good.
Get us there as quickly as   possible, Number One.
Ensign Gibson, warp eight point   eight.
Warp eight point eight, sir.
Estimated time to Daled Four?
(as she checks the     console)   Three hours -- nine minutes.
Ensign Crusher, when you have   completed your duties in   Engineering... report to my Ready   Room.
Yes, sir.
The woman Anya is not what she   appears to be. She is an   allasomorph.
A shape shifter?
Yes. She is not just the   governess, she is also the girl's   protector. I don't like to   interfere in personal   relationships of anyone under my   command, but...
You want me to stay away from   Salia.
Yes, I do. For the good of the   ship and the safety of everyone   on board.
I will do as you ask.
Why won't you let me have a   friend?
It's my duty to protect you from   danger.
There's no danger here!
There's always danger from one   who is not your kind. Salia, he's   confusing you. He'll lead you   from your duties.
Whether I see Wesley is for me   to decide!
It is not! I raised you, I   protected you... and I intend to   deliver you to Daled Four!
Maybe what you want doesn't matter   any more!
Please Salia, I know it's   difficult. But you must do what   you are destined to do.
Standard orbit.
Aye, sir.
Open hailing frequencies, Mister   Worf.
Hailing frequencies open.
Sir, it is unlikely that Daled   Four will respond.
Explain.
The troposphere appears to be   absorbing our signals. It is   fascinating, Captain. Klavdia   Three and Daled Four have almost   identical atmospheres.
Magnify. Times twenty.
The physical resemblance to   Klavdia Three is striking.
Remarkable... How could anyone   live in an environment so totally   hostile to human life?
Apparently Klavdia Three was   chosen for Salia because these   conditions are important for their   species's survival.
Possible, Mister Data.
Or else... they just wanted her   to feel at home.
Come in.
Salia!       You shouldn't have come.
Do you want me to leave?
I didn't say that.
Then you want me to stay.
Does Anya know you're here?
That doesn't matter.
I'm glad you came. I thought   Anya would have kept you with   her.
I have certain rights.
In other words, you slipped away.
While Anya was asleep.
I'm sorry if you got in trouble   with your captain.
I'm not in trouble... yet.
Anya was afraid you would corrupt   me.
With my wild way of life?
Maybe... with the normal things   people do... when they like each   other.
(touches his     communicator)   Security to crew quarters!
No... Anya... NO!
You should not have disobeyed me.
I had to.
I warned you to leave her alone.
You are not supposed to be here.
We are leaving.
Escort them both to their   quarters. And secure it with   a forcefield.

Captain's log, supplemental.   Since Anya's powers of   transformation apparently gave   her the ability to escape her   guards unnoticed, we have sealed   her quarters with a forcefield   that will contain her no matter   how small a form she may take.
Meanwhile we remain unable to   communicate with Daled Four.
Captain -- I'm receiving an audio   signal.
Audio on.
Come in...       This is...       of Daled Four.
Sir, sensors indicate the   communication originated from a   gigawatt source on the planet.
That's more power than our entire   ship can generate.
It is what is needed to penetrate   the atmosphere.
Which means we lack the ability   to respond...
Captain, there are beam-down   coordinates encoded within the   carrier signal.
Splendid.
I'll arrange for our guests to   beam down.
Come in.
We have arrived.
Salia will be with you in just   a moment.
You're not going?
No. My duties have been   completed. I have done all that   I could. I hope it's been enough   and that I did not fail you.
You raised me well, and I thank   you for that.
Don't be angry at me. I would   not have harmed the boy, I only   wanted to frighten him.
I know.
You are ready for what awaits you   and you will do well. I know that   I have been tough on you, but it's   because I want you to be prepared   for whatever you may be required   to do.
Will I ever be able to leave Daled   Four?
Probably not. But, anything is   possible.
That's what Wes said.
I hope he is right.
Where will you go?
The third moon is within range   of this ship's transporter, I will   go there.
I am going to miss you.
I know.
I am ready.
Computer - field off.
Wesley.
Was it fun?
What do you mean?
Playing humanoid. Was it fun?
Wesley, look at me. Right now   -- this moment -- this is what I   am. A humanoid girl.
But what are you really?
Does it matter?
Yes.
I'm sorry I hurt your feelings   -- I didn't mean to.
I loved you.
I love you, too.
Can you?
Yes, oh... yes. I have the same   feeling -- the same emotions as   you. It's time for me to go.
Prepare to beam Salia to the   specified coordinates.
Aye, sir.
Our world is grateful for the   courtesy which you have   extended us.
I hope some day Daled Four and   the Federation will have formal   contact.
That is my wish as well.
Coordinates set, sir.
Proceed.
Wait!
A taste to remember me by.
I wish there were something I   could give you.
You already have.
I'm glad you came to say good-bye.   Thank you... for everything.
I want you to leave now.
Why?
Because I cannot arrive on my   planet in this form and I want   you to remember me as I am now.
We have had enough disguises   between us. It's time for the   truth.
Energize.
Seeing her on the transporter   pad was like seeing pure light.       I miss her. I feel so empty.
I know that sensation.
I'm never going to feel this way   about anyone else.
You're right.
I didn't expect you to say that.
Oh, there will be others -- but,   the next time you feel love will   be different. Each time is   different.
Knowing that doesn't make it any   easier.
It isn't supposed to.
I better get back to my duties.
Me too.
We have the course set for   Aldebaran Zeta, Sir.
Mister Crusher, set speed -- warp six   point five.
Done, Captain.
Engage.
